ROWFOLDERS.FOLDER_INFO:
Version 2, released on 13 Feb 2017, by the South Pacific Division This edition is for use in Australia only
- The printed edition of the Seventh-day Adventist Hymnal was first published in 1985 by the Review and Herald Publishing Association - This digital edition is Copyright © 2017 and published by the Seventh-day Adventist Church (SPD) Limited - The above copyright covers the digital publication, not the words of each hymn - The lyrics for some hymns are in the public domain and not subject to copyright - The lyrics for the remaining hymns are subject to separate copyright - To be used be Seventh-day Adventist Church and affiliated entities only - Certain parts of the content can only be accessed by users that hold a valid licence from Christian Copyright Licensing International (CCLI) - All hymns are listed in this file, but the lyrics are only included where the copyright for those lyrics are either: a) in the public domain; or b) covered by CCLI - Hymns with lyrics that do not meet (a) or (b) above do not have their lyrics included in this file - Hymns with lyrics covered by CCLI (as per (b) above) can only be accessed after valid CCLI licence details have been provided

ROWSONGS.MUSIC_AUTHOR: Wm. S. Bennett, Chorale Book for England

ROWSONGS.SONG_TITLE: All Creatures of Our God and King
ROWSONGS.WORDS_AUTHOR: St. Francis of Assisi, William Henry Draper
ROWSONGS.MUSIC_AUTHOR: arr. by Ralph Vaughan Williams (Lasst Uns Erfreuen)

ROWSONGS.SONG_TITLE: Praise My Soul, the King of Heaven

ROWSONG_SECTIONS.SECTION_TEXT: Praise to the Lord, the Almighty, the King of creation! O my soul, praise Him, for He is thy health and salvation! All ye who hear, Now to His temple draw near; Join ye in glad adoration!

Praise to the Lord, who o'er all things so wondrously reigneth, Shieldeth thee under His wings, yea, so gently sustaineth! Hast thou not seen How thy desires e'er have been Granted in what He ordaineth?
Praise to the Lord, who doth prosper thy work and defend thee; Surely His goodness and mercy here daily attend thee. Ponder anew What the Almighty can do If with His love He befriend thee.
All creatures of our God and King, Lift up your voice with us and sing: Alleluia! Alleluia! O burning sun with golden beam And silver moon with softer gleam:
Oh, praise Him! Oh, praise Him! Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!
O rushing wind and breezes soft, O clouds that ride the winds aloft: Oh, praise Him! Alleluia! O rising morn, in praise rejoice, O lights of evening, find a voice.
O flowing waters, pure and clear, Make music for your Lord to hear. Oh, praise Him! Alleluia! O fire so masterful and bright, Providing us with warmth and light,
Let all things their Creator bless, And worship Him in humbleness, Oh, praise Him! Alleluia! Oh, praise the Father, praise the Son, And praise the Spirit, three in One!
Angels, help us to adore Him: Ye behold Him face to face; Sun and moon bow down before Him: Dwellers all in time and space, Praise Him, praise Him, alleluia, Praise with us the God of grace.
